Battlefield 6 Stats Scraper üìä

Automatically track your Battlefield 6 stats from tracker.gg over time. Your stats get saved to a CSV file that grows with each scrape, perfect for tracking your progress!

‚ö° Quick Start

1. Install Dependencies

npm install
npx playwright install chromium

2. Configure Your Profile URL

Open config.js and change the profileUrl to your tracker.gg profile:

export default {
  // ‚ö†Ô∏è CHANGE THIS TO YOUR PROFILE URL ‚ö†Ô∏è
  profileUrl: 'https://tracker.gg/bf6/profile/YOUR_ID_HERE/overview',
  // ... other settings
};

How to find your tracker.gg URL:

  1. Go to https://tracker.gg/bf6
  2. Search for your gamertag/username
  3. Copy the full URL from your browser (it will look like https://tracker.gg/bf6/profile/1234567890/overview)
  4. Paste it into config.js

3. Run It!

One-time scrape:

npm run scrape

Daily automated scraping:

npm run daily

This will:

  • Run an immediate scrape when you start it
  • Schedule daily scrapes at 9:00 AM (configurable in config.js)
  • Keep running in the background

üìÅ Output

All your data gets saved to the ./data/ directory:

  • bf6-stats-history.csv - Your stats over time (one row per scrape)
  • screenshot-{timestamp}.png - Screenshots of each scrape (for debugging)

üìä What Stats Are Tracked?

The CSV file includes:

  • Profile: Username, Rank Level
  • Core Stats: Score/Min, K/D, Win %, Kills/Min, Wins, Losses
  • Combat Stats: Headshot %, Damage/Min, Kills, Deaths, Assists, Revives
  • Objective Stats: Objective Time %, Objectives Captured/Destroyed
  • Class Stats: Time played and KDA for Recon, Assault, Support, Engineer
  • Weapons: Top 3 weapons with kill counts

Every time the scraper runs, it adds a new row with your current stats!

‚öôÔ∏è Configuration

All settings are in config.js:

export default {
  // Your tracker.gg profile URL
  profileUrl: 'https://tracker.gg/bf6/profile/3176011996/overview',

  // When to run (cron format) - default is 9:00 AM daily
  // Use https://crontab.guru to create custom schedules
  schedule: '0 9 * * *',

  // Your timezone
  timezone: 'America/New_York',

  // Where to save data
  dataDir: './data',

  // CSV filename
  csvFilename: 'bf6-stats-history.csv'
};

Schedule Examples

  • 0 9 * * * - Every day at 9:00 AM (default)
  • 0 */6 * * * - Every 6 hours
  • 0 0 * * 0 - Every Sunday at midnight
  • 0 20 * * * - Every day at 8:00 PM

Use crontab.guru to create your own schedule!

üöÄ Running 24/7 (Optional)

Want to keep it running even when you close your terminal? Use PM2:

npm install -g pm2
pm2 start scheduler.js --name bf6-scraper
pm2 save
pm2 startup  # Follow the instructions to run on system startup

PM2 Commands:

  • pm2 list - See running processes
  • pm2 logs bf6-scraper - View logs
  • pm2 stop bf6-scraper - Stop the scraper
  • pm2 restart bf6-scraper - Restart the scraper
  • pm2 delete bf6-scraper - Remove the scraper

üìà Analyzing Your Data

Your bf6-stats-history.csv file can be opened in:

  • Excel - Double-click the file
  • Google Sheets - File ‚Üí Import
  • Python/R - For custom analysis and charts

üõ†Ô∏è Files Overview

  • config.js - ‚ö†Ô∏è Edit this! Set your profile URL here
  • scraper.js - The main scraper (no need to edit)
  • scheduler.js - Daily scheduler (no need to edit)
  • package.json - Dependencies (no need to edit)

‚ùì Troubleshooting

Problem: "Cannot find profile URL"

  • Make sure you edited config.js with your tracker.gg URL

Problem: "No stats captured"

  • Check the error screenshot in ./data/error-*.png
  • Your profile might be private or the page structure changed
  • Try running npm run scrape again

Problem: "Timeout error"

  • tracker.gg might be slow - try running again
  • Check your internet connection

üìù License

MIT - Do whatever you want with this!

Made for tracking those BF6 gains! üéÆ

# Battlefield 6 Stats Scraper üìä

Automatically track your Battlefield 6 stats from tracker.gg over time. Your stats get saved to a CSV file that grows with each scrape, perfect for tracking your progress!

## ‚ö° Quick Start

### 1. Install Dependencies

```bash
npm install
npx playwright install chromium
```

### 2. Configure Your Profile URL

Open `config.js` and change the `profileUrl` to your tracker.gg profile:

```javascript
export default {
  // ‚ö†Ô∏è CHANGE THIS TO YOUR PROFILE URL ‚ö†Ô∏è
  profileUrl: 'https://tracker.gg/bf6/profile/YOUR_ID_HERE/overview',
  // ... other settings
};
```

**How to find your tracker.gg URL:**
1. Go to https://tracker.gg/bf6
2. Search for your gamertag/username
3. Copy the full URL from your browser (it will look like `https://tracker.gg/bf6/profile/1234567890/overview`)
4. Paste it into `config.js`

### 3. Run It!

**One-time scrape:**
```bash
npm run scrape
```

**Daily automated scraping:**
```bash
npm run daily
```

This will:
- Run an immediate scrape when you start it
- Schedule daily scrapes at 9:00 AM (configurable in `config.js`)
- Keep running in the background

## üìÅ Output

All your data gets saved to the `./data/` directory:

- **`bf6-stats-history.csv`** - Your stats over time (one row per scrape)
- **`screenshot-{timestamp}.png`** - Screenshots of each scrape (for debugging)

## üìä What Stats Are Tracked?

The CSV file includes:

- **Profile:** Username, Rank Level
- **Core Stats:** Score/Min, K/D, Win %, Kills/Min, Wins, Losses
- **Combat Stats:** Headshot %, Damage/Min, Kills, Deaths, Assists, Revives
- **Objective Stats:** Objective Time %, Objectives Captured/Destroyed
- **Class Stats:** Time played and KDA for Recon, Assault, Support, Engineer
- **Weapons:** Top 3 weapons with kill counts

Every time the scraper runs, it adds a new row with your current stats!

## ‚öôÔ∏è Configuration

All settings are in `config.js`:

```javascript
export default {
  // Your tracker.gg profile URL
  profileUrl: 'https://tracker.gg/bf6/profile/3176011996/overview',

  // When to run (cron format) - default is 9:00 AM daily
  // Use https://crontab.guru to create custom schedules
  schedule: '0 9 * * *',

  // Your timezone
  timezone: 'America/New_York',

  // Where to save data
  dataDir: './data',

  // CSV filename
  csvFilename: 'bf6-stats-history.csv'
};
```

### Schedule Examples

- `0 9 * * *` - Every day at 9:00 AM (default)
- `0 */6 * * *` - Every 6 hours
- `0 0 * * 0` - Every Sunday at midnight
- `0 20 * * *` - Every day at 8:00 PM

Use [crontab.guru](https://crontab.guru) to create your own schedule!

## üöÄ Running 24/7 (Optional)

Want to keep it running even when you close your terminal? Use PM2:

```bash
npm install -g pm2
pm2 start scheduler.js --name bf6-scraper
pm2 save
pm2 startup  # Follow the instructions to run on system startup
```

**PM2 Commands:**
- `pm2 list` - See running processes
- `pm2 logs bf6-scraper` - View logs
- `pm2 stop bf6-scraper` - Stop the scraper
- `pm2 restart bf6-scraper` - Restart the scraper
- `pm2 delete bf6-scraper` - Remove the scraper

## üìà Analyzing Your Data

Your `bf6-stats-history.csv` file can be opened in:
- **Excel** - Double-click the file
- **Google Sheets** - File ‚Üí Import
- **Python/R** - For custom analysis and charts

## üõ†Ô∏è Files Overview

- **`config.js`** - ‚ö†Ô∏è Edit this! Set your profile URL here
- **`scraper.js`** - The main scraper (no need to edit)
- **`scheduler.js`** - Daily scheduler (no need to edit)
- **`package.json`** - Dependencies (no need to edit)

## ‚ùì Troubleshooting

**Problem: "Cannot find profile URL"**
- Make sure you edited `config.js` with your tracker.gg URL

**Problem: "No stats captured"**
- Check the error screenshot in `./data/error-*.png`
- Your profile might be private or the page structure changed
- Try running `npm run scrape` again

**Problem: "Timeout error"**
- tracker.gg might be slow - try running again
- Check your internet connection
